snippet: Utility employees from outside the metropolitan area said National Grid had not fully compensated them for their grueling out-of-town shifts after Hurricane Sandy.
abstract: Utility employees who traveled from outside the metropolitan area say National Grid has not fully compensated them for their grueling 16-hour days they put in to help the Long Island Power Authority after Hurricane Sandy.
lead_paragraph: Utility employees from outside the metropolitan area said National Grid had not fully compensated them for their grueling out-of-town shifts after Hurricane Sandy.

headline.seo: Workers Brought to Restore Power on Long Island Still Await Pay
headline.main: They Came to the Rescue; Now, They Wait to Be Paid
headline.print_headline: They Came to the Rescue; Now They Wait to Be Paid
